title: HISTORY OF POP AND ROCK MUSIC - part 524
description:
PART  524


 01. THE ROLLING STONES  -  Heart Of Stone  (1965)
 02. THE ROLLING STONES  -  Play With Fire  (1965)
 03. THE ROLLING STONES  -  The Last Time  (1965)                          
 04. THE ROLLING STONES  -  Time Is On My Side  (1965)
 05. THE ROLLING STONES  -  Im Alright  (1965)
 06. THE ROLLING STONES  -  Mothers Little Helper  (1965)   
 07. THE ROLLING STONES  -  The  Complicated (backing track)
 08. THE ROLLING STONES -Everybody Needs Somebody To Love/Pain In My Heart(1965)   
 09. THE ROLLING STONES  -  Around  & Around  (1965)
 10. THE ROLLING STONES  -  (I Cant Get No) Satisfaction  (1965)



   "Charlie Is My Darling", was the first documntary film about the Rolling Stes. The film was shot during the band's second tour of Ireland, on 3 and 4 September 1965, and was finished in the spring of 1966.It was given its premiere at the Mannheim Film Festival in October 1966, but was never released officially in its full length, due to the legal fights between the Rolling Stones and Allen Klein. In 2012, a restored and extended version was finally released by Allen Klein's ABKCO Records.
   The 64 minutes documentary follows the group from their car trip out of London to Heathrow Airport, and from there to Dublin where they had two concerts at the Adelphi Theatre on 3 September. The next day they take a train up to Belfast for two concerts at the ABC Theatre, before returning to London by plane the following day. Besides stage shots from the concerts, the film contains scenes from a hotel room in Dublin, scenes from their train trip to Belfast, and finally their flight back to London. Intermixed with this are interviews with the band members where they talk about fame, fans and future.
